items.title: Love, power, and my PNG family — Dame Carol Kidu
items.content: Brisbane-born Carol followed her heart to Papua New Guinea in the 1960s. Her husband, Buri Kidu, a young lawyer from a village near the capital with a deep sense of duty went on to became the nation's first Indigenous Chief Justice. After Sir Buri's premature death, Carol entered politics, blazing a trail for women in a intensely patriarchal political system

items.title: The blue budgie in Berlin — Gisela Kaplan's story

items.content:
When he was a young boy in South Africa, Professor Mark Solms watched his older brother fall from a roof and crack his skull.
